channel.title: Recipes on Family Recipes
channel.description: Recent content in Recipes on Family Recipes

item.title: Is this Pad Thai? No This is Patrick
item.description: Mix the lime juice, brown sugar, soy sauce, white wine vinegar, sriracha sauce, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl and set aside. Cook the rice noodles as per instructions on the box. Saute the chicken until browned with salt and pepper. Add the garlic. Push the chicken to the side of the pan. Saute the red pepper and the chili pepper. Push the chicken and peppers to the side and add the egg.

item.title: Margarita
item.description: Combine lime juice, orange liquor, tequila, salt, and sugar in a shaker with an ice cube and shake vigorously until the ice cube has melted. Pour into a tumbler glass filled with ice. Pour splash of fruited liquor over the top. This recipe also works with mezcal instead of tequila.

item.title: Fish Tacos
item.description: Prep the fish by rinsing and patting dry. In a small bowl, stir fish rub spices together. Sprinkle all sides of fish lightly with the spice rub. Set aside. Make the slaw by placing the shredded cabbage in a medium bowl. Toss with the salt. Add the onions, cilantro, jalape√±o, lime juice, olive oil and toss well. Grease the grill well before placing fish on it. Turn heat to medium.

item.title: Molasses Cookies
item.description: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger and salt. Set aside. Using a separate mixing bowl, either with a stand mixer or a hand mixer, cream together the softened butter and sugars on medium-high speed until the mixture is light and fluffy and a pale yellow color, about 2 minutes, scraping down the sides occasionally as needed. Mix in the eggs (one at a time) and molasses, and beat on medium-low speed until each is combined.
